In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(text::String; text_width::Int=10)
    result = ""
    words = split(text, ' ', keepempty=false)
    line_length = 0
    for i in 1:length(words)
        word_len = length(words[i])
        if i > 1
            word_len += 1
        end
        if line_length + word_len > text_width
            result *= "\n"
            line_length = 0
        end
        if i > 1
            result *=  " "
            line_length += 1
        end
        result *= words[i]
        line_length += length(words[i])
    end
    return result
end

text = "Hello and welcome! This is a very short example of what we want to achieve. The text will be split in multiple lines."

wrapped_string = wrap_string(text)

print(wrapped_string)
```
